screeningSummary: Family in Victorian home where child describes previous owner Margaret in detail matching historical records

textVariants.text: You're on the air. Tell us about your house.
Alright, you're on. What's this about your house?
YOU ARE ON THE AIR! Tell us about your house!
You're on. Make it quick - what's wrong with your house?
You're on. So?
Oh good, a haunted house story! Tell us everything!
You're on. Describe the residential property and any unusual phenomena.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Vern, my family moved into an old Victorian six months ago. I don't think we're alone in there, and I've tried to explain it away but I can't anymore.

textVariants.text: What's been happening? Walk me through it.
What's been happening... alright, walk me through it.
This is gonna be GOOD! What's been happening?!
What's been happening. Let me guess - spooky stuff?
What's been happening?
Six months in a VICTORIAN and you DON'T think you're alone?! This is EXCITING!
Duration of occupancy is six months. What specific phenomena have you observed?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Started small. Footsteps upstairs when everyone's downstairs. Doors that open on their own. Cold spots that seem to move through rooms. Normal haunting stuff, you know?

textVariants.text: Old houses do strange things. Could be the structure settling, drafts, old wood shifting.
Look, old houses settle, drafts happen... you know how it is...
FOOTSTEPS, DOORS OPENING, COLD SPOTS! This is AMAZING!
Footsteps, doors, cold spots. Of course it was. Classic haunted house, right?
Old houses do strange things. Could be settling.
FOOTSTEPS UPSTAIRS when everyone's DOWNSTAIRS! I LOVE this show!
Acoustic phenomena, thermal anomalies, and door movement. What structural factors have you considered?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: That's what I told myself. For months. Then my seven-year-old started having conversations with someone named Margaret. At first I thought it was an imaginary friend.

textVariants.text: Kids invent imaginary friends. It's common and doesn't necessarily mean anything supernatural.
Kids make up imaginary friends... that's normal stuff...
A SEVEN-YEAR-OLD having CONVERSATIONS! This is UNREAL!
Kids invent imaginary friends. You know that, right?
Kids make up imaginary friends. What's your take?
A CHILD talking to someone named MARGARET! This is PERFECT!
Child's imaginary companion. At what age did this begin and what are the interaction patterns?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: She described an elderly woman in a blue Victorian dress. Specific details - the cameo brooch she always wore, the way her hair was styled. I found an obituary - the previous owner died in that house twenty years ago. Her name was Margaret. Blue was her favorite color.

textVariants.text: Document everything - dates, times, what happens, your daughter's descriptions. Establishing patterns helps understand the nature of what's happening. Thanks for calling in.
Yeah, maybe document stuff if you want. Thanks for calling.
Document EVERYTHING! This is INCREDIBLE! Margaret in BLUE!
Right, well... document it if you want. Thanks for calling.
Good report. Document what you can. Thanks.
This is PERFECT! Document everything and SEND IT TO US!
Please document specific dates, times, observed behaviors, and your daughter's detailed descriptions. Pattern analysis requires systematic data collection.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Good idea. Thank you for listening, Vern. I just needed to tell someone who wouldn't just laugh it off.

arcNotes: Family with child involved, previous owner connection, child medium-like ability, escalating concern
